author: bridge-bot
content:
<sigpaul> Hmm, it seems that the spec is a little unclear here.
On the one hand, the genesis block should have an all-zeros execution payload since we define the genesis block as:
genesis_block = BeaconBlock(state_root=hash_tree_root(genesis_state))
On the other hand, the BeaconState has the latest_execution_payload_header set to some initial values.
Since LH is loading the genesis block from the DB to obtain the latest block hash, it's returning all-zeros. However, if it loaded the BeaconState and read the latest header it'd get a different value.
I'm really starting to feel that the merge initialize_beacon_state_from_eth1 is a waste of time and we should just do the fork transition. There's less edge-cases and we get to test the fork more. (re @dapplion: In M2 genesis contains execution payload so any finalized block contains an execution payload block hash)

author: bridge-bot
content: <sigpaul> I guess there's some value in having `initialize_beacon_state_from_eth1` for starting future non-mainnet chains.
